item.description:
• Sacred World Interdependence Day celebrates its 5th year hosted at the most lustrous and beautiful Earthlands Nature Preserve in Petersham, MA, coming together for an extended weekend of community building, art, dance, sustainability, healing and information sharing!
    July 6th - 8th 2012.

    Full weekend passes are currently available. Single Day and One night overnights will be available closer to the gathering.

    Energy and proceeds will help support the HeARTbeat Collective and Future-SWID Productions Amazing New Land Trust Project (stay tuned).

    We were all born to be creative. Sacred World Interdependence Day (SWID) around July 4th weekend brings people together to reclaim inspiration through the performing (expressive) and healing arts, and through building healthy relations to the world we are a part of.

    SWID offers a variety of in depth classes in wild crafting, sustainability, alternative healing modalities, sacred dance, shamanism, fire spinning and community activism etc. Musical acts take the stage for your dancing and listening pleasure. Artists gather to create interactive art installations to engage and inspire.

    On Friday night The Sacred World Bellydance Review will be showcasing local dancers and artists. On Saturday night we hold an all night Sacred Fire Circle Ceremony bringing a sense of ritual, renewal and healing by drumming, dancing and singing till dawn.

    Earthlands Preserve is a truly beautiful off the grid facility operated by the Institute of Environmental Awareness.
    The event's capacity is limited to 300 people (at one time). This is a camping event. All attendees are asked to bring food to share, and to offer an hour of service to help hold the event.

    REGISTRATION IS OPEN!!! SEE BELOW TO REGISTER...

    2012MUSICIANS:
    Coyote Kolb
    Endangered Speeches
    Kina Zore
    Incus
    Julie Woods
    Groove Commission
    Liron Peled (Raquy and the Cavemen)
    Melodeego
    Mother Turtle
    Jaishree & the Prema Bhakti Band
    Spider Cider
    More TBA:

    2012 WORKSHOP PRESENTERS:
    Ambe and Moses: SWID Cacao Ceremony
    Liron Peled: Middle Eastern Drumming (Beginner / Intermediate)
    Tara Murphy: African Dance
    Mikki Baloy Davis: Journey to Your Muse
    Venus Zephyr: Love Letters Spoken Word for your Soul Flower
    Jenniefer Pipp: Tribe of Infinite Beauty
    Kristin Rajroop Brockett: Plant Spirit Medicine and Journeying
    Steve Restmeyer: Medicinal Mushrooms-the Polypores
    Naraya: Foundational Belly Dance
    Rahima Sage: Zikr Allah - Sufi Chanting Practice of Remembrance
    Amy Dawn Vanderbay: Circus Yoga: The Human Art of Play
    Richard A Adams: Drumming for Dummies: Breaking Down the Barriers to Rhythmic Fulfillment
    Mother Turtle: HEALING the STORIES WE TELL OURSELVES
    Malu Wilder: Nagasu Rope Dart 101, the art of Rope Dance, & Safety Third: Fire Safety for current and new fire performers
    Antonio Aversano: Breath Awakening: Transformation Session
    Lexi Templer: Inherent Flow - attuning to our highest self through asana, pranayama, mudra and ecstatic dance
    Brynn Bishop: Tantric Puja w/ Michael Trachtman and Penny Goldmuntz
    Laney Goodman: Global Healing With the Mother Drum
    Carolyn Kepes: The Sphere of Venus and the Warrior of the Heart
    Vadalna Tribal Dance Co: Not Your Mama’s Tribal Fusion or Tribal Belly Dance Fundamentals
    DJ FreQ Nasty and Claire Thompson: The Yoga of Bass - A Talk On Music, Yoga, and the Search for Freedom

    For more info and bios: www.heartbeatcollective.or g/SWID2012workshops

    2012 DANCE & BELLYDANCE PERFORMANCE:
    Vadalna Tribal Dance Co.
    Shae Rossi
    Amy Dawn Vanderbay
    Laura Blake
    Di'Ahna Restry
    Heather Powers
    Cait Capaldi
    MORE TBA:

    2012 VENDORS
    A THOUSAND THREADS
    Una Gallagher
    HEARTBLOOD CACAO MERCHANTS
    Moses & Ambe
    PACHAWAWA DESIGNS
    Julian Goldstone
    BONE-FLOWER BOTANIKALS
    Venus Free
    SOUNDING SPIRIT MUSIC: Native American style flutes and instruments to ignite the Spirit!
    Antonio Aversano
    MORE TBA:

    Venus Rising: The Galiana Meditation Community 
    A sacred theatre performance: Beyond the land of dreams, Spiderwoman sends two gods to Earth to awaken humanity. Follow the journey of the Dreamcatcher and Venus as they chase the dreams of humanity through the four elements and beyond the end of life to bring back the sacred ways of love.

    $25 Day Pass (Friday or Saturday)
    $40 One Night/2 Days (Friday-Saturday, or Saturday to Sunday)
    $50 Entire Gathering
    $5 Sunday Day Only Special

    REGISTRATION IS OPEN
    Day Passes and Single Overnight Tickets will be made available closer to the gathering.
    All Attendees are asked to offer an Hour of Service and to bring Food Donations for our Community Kitchen, if eating with
    the community. Earthlands is a vegetarian retreat center. Organic and Native Foods are preferred for this gathering.
    PLEASE COME DURING LISTED REGISTRATION TIMES.
    CHECK FACT PAGE FOR THOSE TIMES.
    THANK YOU.
    MANY BLESSINGS!

    For more information or to register please visit www.heARTbeatCollective.or g/SWID

    There are still some Volunteer Positions open. Please contact Jason@heARTbeatCollective.org.

Earthlands 39 Glasheen Road, Petersham, Massachusetts 01366 View Map · Get Directions
item.name: SWID Sacred World Independence day!
